name: klatch
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an occasion when people meet socially to talk: She and her mother enjoyed a coffee klatch with each other almost every morning. She accepted an invitation to join the other nurses for an informal coffee klatsch. The store's proprietor hosts a regular klatch of patrons who gather for free coffee and idle gossip.
More examplesFewer examplesThe governor holds a weekly coffee klatch for reporters.The Writers' Group is a weekend klatch of panels and readings that draws many of the region's novelists, poets, and fans. Smokers gather outside the back door of the building for their morning cigarette klatch.His poker klatsch has strict rules on conversational topics.
